intro: Murdannia spirata var. spirata, commonly known as spiral sedge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, spirally arranged leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spikelets. Murdannia spirata var. spirata is often found in wet or marshy habitats and is adapted to thrive in moist environments.
